business.headline: Explained: Why Sensex nosedived 1,000 points todayStock market today: For now, analysts recommend cautious optimism as the Indian market grapples with global pressures and internal headwinds, while awaiting signs of stabilization in the months to come.

Suzlon shares fall over 9% today, 22% in 5 sessions. More downside ahead?Suzlon stock price: Suzlon Energy shares dropped 9.26% in Wednesday's trading session, hitting a low of Rs 53.89. The shares also dropped 22% in its previous 5 sessions.

Sensex slides 1,000 points: 4 factors behind stock market weaknessStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 969.44 points to 77,705.74 at 2:49 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 319.25 points to trade at 23,564.20.
Swiggy CEO makes rare appearance at IPO listing, shares origin storySwiggy shares listed at a premium of 8% over issue price, beating GMP estimates on the National Stock Exchange (NSE).

Swiggy or Zomato: Which stock will deliver better returns to investors?Although Swiggy is trailing Zomato in profitability and scale, analysts believe its market position and diverse revenue streams offer potential for long-term growth.

Zinka Logistics Solution IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Zinka Logistics Solution Limited IPO comprises a fresh issue of 2.01 crore shares, raising Rs 550 crore, along with an offer for sale of 2.07 crore shares, amounting to Rs 564.72 crore.

Swiggy IPO listing delivers pleasant surprise to investors. Sell now or hold?Swiggy listing: With the company's shares opening at Rs 420 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a solid 7.6% premium over its issue price of Rs 390, the performance has exceeded initial expectations

'You and I…': Zomato welcomes Swiggy on Dalal Street post stock market listingSwiggy market listing: Zomato's social media post, featuring a banner announcing Swiggy's listing, showcased a friendly nod between the two food tech giants.

Dalal Street debut goes dim for Acme Solar, lists at 13% discountAcme Solar shares listing: The stock debuted on the BSE Sensex at Rs 259 per share, marking a 10.3% drop from its issue price of Rs 289 per share.
Swiggy shares list at 8% premium over issue price, beating GMP estimates Swiggy IPO share price listing: Share list at 8% premium over issue price, beating GMP estimates

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Check price band, issue size, GMP NTPC Green Energy IPO aims to raise Rs 10,000 crore, making it the third-largest IPO of the year, following Hyundai Motors India's Rs 28,756 crore IPO and Swiggy's Rs 11,327 crore public listing.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as cautious sentiment prevails in marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 76.81 points to 78,598.37, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 75 points to 23,808.45.

GIFT Nifty slips 45 points: What to expect in today's market sessionExperts mentioned that fears around Trump's potential tariff policies, especially targeting China, are weighing on emerging markets like India.

Stocks to watch: Vodafone Idea, Eicher Motors, GRSE, Swiggy, NykaaStocks to watch: Shares of Vodafone Idea, Eicher Motors, GRSE are in the spotlight as these companies will announce their Q2 FY25 results today, making them potential movers in the day's trading.

Swiggy IPO listing: Latest GMP signals weak market debut Swiggy share price, IPO listing: Swiggy shares will make their market debut on the stock exchanges after having seen an overall subscription of 3.59 times.
Jyotiraditya Scindia on Musk's Starlink licence: Approval after security complianceTesla CEO Elon Musk, the world's richest man, has been eyeing entry to the Indian telecom sector with Starlink.

Sensex tumbles over 800 points. Here's how much money investors lostAnalysts attributed the selloff to continued foreign investor outflows and disappointing quarterly earnings, particularly in banking and auto sectors. Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) reportedly offloaded Rs 2,306 crore worth of Indian equities, extending their selling spree.

Swiggy IPO listing: Around 500 employees likely to become crorepatisSwiggy's IPO stock market listing: The grey market premium (GMP) of Rs 2 ahead of Wednesday's debut indicates only a marginal gain of 0.51% above the issue price.
Retail inflation at a 14-month high, rises to 6.21% in OctoberThe inflation rate currently stands at 6.68% in rural areas, surpassing the urban inflation rate, which is recorded at 5.62%.

Sensex tanks 820 points, Nifty tumbles: 4 factors behind stock market bloodbathAfter opening in green, the S&P BSE Sensex reversed course, dragged down by banking, financial services, and auto stocks. The Nifty50, too, faced a broad-based decline, with nearly all sectoral indices closing in the red except for Nifty Realty.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Nitish Kumar tries to touch PM's feet at Bihar event. Modi does this nextIn a video that has gone viral on social media, Nitish Kumar, 73, is seen walking towards PM Modi, 74, with folded hands and bowing to touch his feet. The incident happened

Executive can't become judge: Supreme Court warning on bulldozer actionThe top court emphasised that the executive cannot assume the role of adjudication, stating that the arbitrary demolition of a citizen's home on mere accusations violates constitutional law and the principle of separation of powers.

Stay alert, united, say Hindutva forces as Fadnavis holds up Dhule exampleMaharashtra Assembly Election: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis is citing the example of the Dhule Lok Sabha seat to warn voters. The RSS is trying to consolidate Hindu votes even as PM Modi gave the 'Ek hai to safe hai' call. What was the outcome in Dhule and is the BJP wary?

Taliban name student as Afghan envoy in Mumbai, India yet to respondThe Taliban regime of Afghanistan has named Ikramuddin Kamil, who has done his PhD in international law from New Delhi's South Asia University, as the 'acting consul' to its Mumbai mission. The proposal is waiting approval from India. The Taliban move comes a week after an Indian delegation visited Kabul.

How misspelt meme inspired Trump's powerful Musk-headed DOGEThe 'Great' Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy will lead DOGE to overhaul American bureaucracy. It's fascinating that a department inspired by a misspelt meme of a Shiba Inu dog is going to impact the world's most-powerful country as Donald Trump takes charge.

Sunita Williams addresses health concerns from Space StationShe explained that her physical appearance has changed due to the rigorous exercise regimen astronauts follow to combat the effects of microgravity on muscle and bone density.

Explained: Why Sensex nosedived 1,000 points todayStock market today: For now, analysts recommend cautious optimism as the Indian market grapples with global pressures and internal headwinds, while awaiting signs of stabilization in the months to come.

EPS dismisses all rumours of AIADMK-BJP reunion ahead of 2026 state pollsAIADMK general secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami clarified that his party will not ally with BJP. His clarification came after his earlier comments on working with like-minded parties to defeat DMK led to rumours of a reunion between former allies.
Coldplay announces new show in AhmedabadColdplay announced their new show in Ahmedabad. They are set to perform at the Narendra Modi Stadium in January.
Harnessing the Power of Data: IIM Kozhikode's Professional Certificate Programme in Advanced Data Analytics for ManagersEmpowering Managers with Data-Driven Insights for Strategic Decision-Making

Assembly bypolls: Voting underway in 31 seats in big INDIA vs BJP contestAssembly bypolls: The bypolls are being seen as a litmus test for the Congress and the INDIA bloc following the debacle in the recently held Haryana elections.

'Sikandar' lyricist threatens Salman Khan in bid to become famous, arrestedThe threats were sent by 24-year-old Sohail Pasha, who claimed to be the writer of a song "Main Sikandar Hoon" and wanted to be famous.

Kerala artist's animated video shows Spider-Man, Deadpool, Hulk dancing to ChuttamalleA Kerala-based artist made an animated video that shows Spider-Man, Deadpool and Hulk dancing to the popular Telugu track Chuttamalle.

Gujarat Titans appoint Parthiv Patel as batting coach ahead of IPL 2025 auctionGujarat Titans appointed Parthiv Patel as batting coach ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction. The former India wicketkeeper-batter replaced Gary Kirsten for the role in the franchise.

What is DOGE? Biting dog now controlled by Elon Musk was once a meme and crypto coinDOGE is now the Department of Government Efficiency, an agency through which Elon Musk and his fellow MAGA brother Vivek Ramaswamy will be keeping a check on the entire US government. In more innocent times, Doge used to be just a playful Shiba Inu.

Uddhav Thackeray on 'ek hai toh safe hai': Meant for BJP as it wants to rule soloIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Uddhav Thackeray spoke on a range of topics, from the chief ministerial face of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) to the row over his luggage being inspected by election officials.

Why are countries fighting over money at COP29 climate summit?Countries are negotiating a higher target for payments starting next year, but some have been reluctant to confirm its size until it is clear which countries will contribute.

India's alliance balance: After US Predator drones, stealth frigates from RussiaNew Delhi is not only strengthening its decades-old defence partnership with Moscow but also asserting  to the West its strategic autonomy in an increasingly polarised world

When Vivek Ramaswamy was 18: School speech emerges as he readies for DOGE roleIn the clip shared on X, the 18-year-old Vivek Ramaswamy, with confidence on his sleeve, could be heard urging his classmates to reflect on the journey ahead.

Essential for fair polls: Ajit Pawar says he too was frisked, shares videoMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and the BJP shared videos of officials checking the bags of Pawar and Devendra Fadnavis, amid the controversy over the frisking of Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray's bags.
Scientist treats her breast cancer using lab-grown virusesCroatian scientist Beata Halassy successfully treated her stage 3 breast cancer using lab-grown viruses, avoiding chemotherapy.

Delhi's toxic air: Why you should not take your cough lightly Delhi Air Pollution: High levels of air pollution in northern India have caused health issues like persistent cough and itchy eyes among citizens. Doctors report an increase in patients with cough-like symptoms.

Patient's son stabs doctor 7 times in Chennai hospital, arrestedA doctor at Kalaignar Centenary Hospital in Chennai was stabbed by a man whose mother was admitted there. Chief Minister MK Stalin has ordered a detailed enquiry and assured strict action against the perpetrator.

Democrat Senator's 'efficient' dig at Elon Musk-Vivek Ramaswamy heading DOGEUS Senator Elizabeth Warren's remark came hours after Donald Trump named billionaire Elon Musk and former Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy to lead the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) to clean up the federal bureaucracy.

Rashmika Mandanna dubs for Pushpa 2, calls first half of film 'freaking amazing'Rashmika Mandanna is currently dubbing for Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2: The Rule. The actor completed dubbing for the first half and called it 'freaking amazing'.

Shah Rukh Khan in talks for Baazigar 2: ReportShah Rukh Khan, who earned immense acclaim for his role in the 1993 film Baazigar, is reportedly in discussions to headline the sequel to the romantic thriller.

Ajay Devgn never worries about length of his role, co-stars: Rohit ShettyBollywood star Ajay Devgn and director Rohit Shetty have worked together on multiple movies together. Shetty recently spoke to India Today Digital about the Singham Again star, their collaborations and more.

Vikrant Massey calls Vidhu Vinod 'difficult to work with': He tells the truthVikrant Massey calls Vidhu Vinod Chopra "difficult to work with" but praises his straightforwardness and purity. He sees Chopra as a father figure and hopes to emulate his approach at 72.

sports.headline: IPL Auction prediction: Which players can SRH target with Rs 45 crore budgetIPL 2024 finalists SunRisers Hyderabad retained the majority of their core ahead of the mega-auction. Which players can they target to continue their new-found success in the tournament?

Sanjay Manjrekar on India's chances in Australia: 4-0 is a distant dreamFormer India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has suggested India to take one step at a time in the upcoming five-match Test series against Australia.

Lizelle Lee becomes first player to hit back-to-back hundreds in WBBL historyLizelle Lee became the first player in WBBL history to hit back-to-back centuries. After scoring the highest individual score of 150 in the last match, Lee hit 103 vs Adelaide Strikers on Wednesday.

Above my pay grade: Inglis on Australia naming 'B' side vs Pakistan in T20IsJosh Inglis didn't find it fair to call Australia's T20I squad vs Pakistan as 'B side' as he realised the scheduling of other matches as well. Inglis will lead Australia in the 3-match T20Is vs Pakistan.

Arjun Tendulkar's maiden Ranji Trophy 5-wicket haul dismantles Arunachal PradeshGoa all-rounder Arjun Tendulkar  picked his maiden five wicket haul in Ranji Trophy against Arunachal Pardesh and bundled them out for 84.

Mohammad Shami's absence major blow for India vs Australia: Paul AdamsPaul Adams highlighted that Mohammad Shami's absence could be a major blow for India. However, the India pacer is set for a comeback after his long injury layoff.

Australia's coach Daniel Vettori likely to miss Perth Test to attend IPL auctionAustralia's assistant coach Daniel Vettori is likey to miss the first Test of the series against India in Perth to attend IPL 2025 auction for Sunrisers Hyderabad.

ATP Finals: Carlos Alcaraz won't be at 100 percent for Rublev clash, says coachCarlos Alcaraz's performance in the ATP Finals is under threat as he battles illness, affecting his preparation for a crucial match against Andrey Rublev. Coach Juan Carlos Ferrero reveals the Spaniard's struggles with breathing, impacting his game readiness.

Recapping BGT: When India faced shoddy umpiring and poor game spirit in SydneyThe Sydney Test played between India and Australia in 2008 is remembered as the most controversial Test match played between two countries as the game witnessed poor umpiring and several other heated moments between the two teams.

Mike Tyson shows aggression, Jake Paul wears bizarre head gear for open workoutsMike Tyson rolled back the years with an aggressive approach during his open workout session while Jake Paul decided to taunt the boxing legend by wearing a rooster hat on November 12, Tuesday.

WI vs ENG: Andre Russell ruled out of remaining 3 T20Is, Alzarri Joseph returnsWest Indies will be without the services of all-rounder Andre Russell for the remainder of the England T20Is as the squad announced on November 12, Tuesday. Alzarri Joseph makes his return to the side after serving his 2-match ban.

After their batting flopped in Gqberha, India stars will be keen on putting on a better show in Centurion on Wednesday.

On This Day: Rohit Sharma hits 264 vs Sri Lanka, highest ODI score in historyOn November 13, 2014, at Eden Gardens in Kolkata, Rohit Sharma set a new benchmark in ODI cricket by scoring 264 runs against Sri Lanka, the highest individual score in the format till date. This remarkable innings featured 33 fours and 9 sixes.

Virat and I have talked about it few times: Rahul recalls IPL 2016 finalKL Rahul talked about RCB's heartbreaking defeat in the final of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2016 where Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH), led by David Warner, came up trumps. RCB failed to chase down a target of 209 despite fifties from Chris Gayle and Virat Kohli.

Ricky Ponting hits back at 'prickly' Gautam Gambhir, defends take on Virat KohliRicky Ponting has clarified his recent comments about Virat Kohli and claimed that he wasn't trying to take a jibe at the Indian star batter. Ponting also said that Gautam Gambhir was a 'prickly character' and wasn't surprised to see him lash out at his Kohli remark.

You're going to fire Virat Kohli up: Ex-Australia cricketer slams Ponting remarkFormer Australia cricketer Shane Lee has slammed Ricky Ponting's remarks about Virat Kohli and claimed it was a bad move from the former Aussie captain. Ponting had questioned Kohli's form heading into the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
